## Perlin.fractalNoise1d() method

Generate a one-dimensional FBM.

**Signature:**

```typescript
fractalNoise1d(x: number, options?: FractalOptions1D): number;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

x


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

The position for generating one-dimensional Perlin noise.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[FractalOptions1D](./perlin.ts.fractaloptions1d.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The configuration of the FBM, See [FractalOptions1D](./perlin.ts.fractaloptions1d.md) for more.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

number

The normalized noise value, with a range from -1 to 1.

## Remarks

Fractal noise realizes more intricate details by overlaying various noise layers of distinct frequencies and amplitudes, making it applicable for scenarios that demand multi-scale detail like the creation of natural landscapes.

## Example


```typescript
const perlin:Perlin = new Perlin();

// The basic case
perlin.fractalNoise1d(0.5);

// The advanced case
const options:FractalOptions1D = {
  octaves: 5,
  amplitude: 1.0,
  persistence: 1.5,
  frequency: {x: 0.001},
  lacunarity: {x: 2.0},
  offset: {x: 21.0},
}
perlin.fractalNoise1d(10, options);
```
